website_summaries.verdict: Thick cat box liner that will resist tearing from animal claws.
pros: Easy to use, as it has a drawstring to close the bag when it's time for disposal
Heavy-duty liner material that's 2 millimeters thick to keep the litter inside the bag
Large size of liner at 36 by 18 inches, so it'll fit multi-cat litter boxes
cons: Doesn't work as well on small sized litter boxes

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Liners
customer_reviews.text: If you use/need cat litter box liners for a large/jumbo sized litter box, get these. They are the right size for the larger/jumbo litter boxes and they are the strongest liners that I think you can find. If you have a regular size litter box, these will be very big, really too big. I haven't found any beter liners and one of my cats has knives for claws. He still sometimes can make holes in these liners, but it's not bad and like I said he has crazy claws
customer_reviews.author: JRA

customer_reviews.title: Chore completed in under 3 minutes
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried a dozen or more cat box liners. Either they were too thin and the cats claws ripped the liners, or they didn’t quite fit the larger boxes, or the draw string was flimsy. These are high quality thick plastic liners that really resist tearing. We are a 3 cat household and use roughly 3 inches of generic clay litter changing every 3 days. These have never failed. Not litter escapes. Just use the wide red drawstring to close and lift. No mess!! Set aside and replace; dispose of used litter with no spills and you are done in under 3 minutes
customer_reviews.author: ChiefLaughALot

customer_reviews.title: Size has changed
customer_reviews.text: I have used this. Read and size for years. However the box that came most recently, the bags were smaller and did. It fit our jumbo liter boxes like they have in the past. Very disappointed. They need to go back to their previous fit.
customer_reviews.author: Lin H. Fryman

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by a friend
customer_reviews.text: Did not like using them at all. Had to tie them on the litter box to keep them in place & always readjust them. Bag ripped with scooping. Gave them to my friend!
customer_reviews.author: Rosebud

customer_reviews.title: I just love Johnny Cat Litter Box Liners
customer_reviews.text: I just love Johnny Cat Litter Box Liners. I use the Booda Cat Boxes that are dome shaped with the lid. These are strong bags and they are the only ones I can find that fit properly in the box. I poop scoop during the week and once a week I just take the whole bag out. It's nice and clean that way. You can use the cheaper cat litter instead Of the exspensive clumping kind. My 2 cats love it. I have 3 boxes for 2 cats.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Fuller

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY bags I’ll use in my litter box!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great! They may be a little pricey but nothing beats being able to pickup the bag without spilling cat **** everywhere. I’ve tried many different brands and these are the only ones that my cats can’t tear through. I have a high sided litter box and these bags hold quite a lot of litter! I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Renee

customer_reviews.title: thickest bags I've seen
customer_reviews.text: Love these jumbo sized bags. I have two cats sharing the litter box and sometimes they liked to dig at the bag. these are the thickest I've found in 30+ years . I don't get any leakage/steeping of urine through the bottom of the bag which is a relief when you're changing litter. I don't have the best shoulders for heavy litter , but this morning I lifted the bag out and the strap was long enough that I just put it over my shoulder like a purse and walked it outside--no breakage!.
customer_reviews.author: Carol O.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about buying plastic litter box liners because one of our cats loves to dig. He destroyed earlier attempts at using liners. But these liners are VERY THICK. We haven't had any rips, tears, or holes. We have three completely different litter boxes. One is sort of a triangle shape. These liners cover all of them well. One thing is that it would be nice if there were more liners per box instead of having to buy four at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I like them.  Will continue to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have a jumbo kitty litter box for my two pre-madonnas. So I use these jumbo liners that many recommended. They last about a week and a half without rips. Generally durable and easy enough to cinch up and throw out. Because my cats like to rip into it, I end up having to put the used bag in a trash bag when I'm changing it. Overall, I would definitely recommend these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Haley P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Prodict
customer_reviews.text: These liners are the best I’ve found to resist cat claws. They last much longer than other brands making disposal lots easier.
customer_reviews.author: Maxine B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good quality litter bags!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these liners in the Litter Robot Open Air; they are a bit bigger than the tray -- but since the Litter Robot stops cycling when it senses that the tray is full, the size is not an issue. What always troubled me with the other, cheaper liners was that they were so flimsy (even without cats' claws raking over them) that I'd have to double-bag or risk tracking cat litter all over the house after changing/disposing of a full bag. These bags are really tough, sturdy! They would hold up to the most dedicated cat scratching!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Grinnell

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market, but doesn’t solve your problems
customer_reviews.text: As far as liners go, these are the best on the market. That being said, they still end up with claw holes, urine clumps between folds, and they don’t fit flush against the box. If you absolutely must use a litter box liner, this is your best option, but it still has all of the usual problems associated with liners. My recommendation is to just nut up, stop using liners. and put a little more effort into your cat’s litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Will purchase again... and again... and again
customer_reviews.text: It's probably weird to say I "love" a cat litter box liner, but I love these cat litter box liners! Makes a gross job... not all that gross! I only change the cat litter once a week. I use these and Arm & Hammer cat litter. These together make changing the cat litter EASY PEASY!
customer_reviews.author: amoore

customer_reviews.title: Winner!!!
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best, hands down! I've never had cat litter liners work so well! Never a tear in the bag when I go to remove them and my cats can do some damage on litter box liners. These fit the large boxes so well with a little room to spare without straining to get them to fit!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Love these liners. I have a large and an even larger cat box and these liners fit both. They are great because you just lift, tighten the strings on the bag and toss, just like normal trash. The bag is thick and durable too so messes or leaks are uncommon. Unless your cat goes nuts with the scratching and poking holes with nails, then some litter may fall through holes and land in bottom of pan. My 2 cats don't seem phased by liner or its texture either.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, hard to tear litter box liners
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, hard to tear litter box liners. We have tried numerous brands over the years, and were almost always disappointed with the quality. These bags are rugged and hard to tear and are the best we have ever used. Now we won't buy anything else. We recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Joann S.

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love these litter bags. They are a life saver in my two-cat household. They make clean-up so much easier and make much less of a mess. I buy these monthly and rely on them for my litter-needs. I would HIGHLY recommend them to anyone with a cat!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Shumaker

customer_reviews.title: Two large cats with two large litter boxes - these work nicely
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these for several years for our two Maine Coon mix kitties. The material holds up well, and fits our extra-large boxes very well.
customer_reviews.author: Genuine Redhead

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and durable. I love this product. It makes it easy to clean the litter box.

customer_reviews.title: Best Litter Bags
customer_reviews.text: I wish they were just a bit wider. I need to stretch them a bit before putting them on litter box
customer_reviews.author: Wallybird

customer_reviews.title: It works and it is big!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for being big enough to fit all the way up the sides on my weirdly shaped fake plant pot litter box and being strong enough that there aren't holes when my cat digs to China.

customer_reviews.title: good for multiple cats
customer_reviews.text: I have two (formerly three) very messy cats and this is a perfect cat box liner for them. I highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Good liners.
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite liners. They are nice and thick. Most liners are very thin plastic and the cat just makes holes in them. Easy to lift with the ties. Never have had them break.

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy product.
customer_reviews.text: These liners are the only ones I have found that are both thick and fit extra large littler boxes. Many large liners are paper-thin and develop holes quickly as cats bury their treasures. These, on the other hand, are very thick with sturdy drawstrings. I have a large, oval box and several square boxes; these liners work well in both. My pet store no longer stocks these liners, so I order them online and the price is actually cheaper. I would not use anything else in my litterboxes.

customer_reviews.title: Convenience
customer_reviews.text: I love this because I was always cleaning the litter box and waiting for it to dry. This made life simple for me.

It's nice to just be able to lift out the liner, pull the tie, and throw it out, without cleaning up litter spills. Just wish they weren't so expensive.

product_meta.title: JONNY CAT Litter Box Liners, Heavy Duty, Jumbo 5 Per Box (4 Pack/Boxes)
product_meta.description: Color:Original VersionJonny Cat Litter Box Liners make it easy for you to clean up after your feline friends. With a tough, resilient construction, these liners never quit. Jumbo cat litter box liners are ideal for boxes used by more than one cat.
feature_bullets: Pack of 4 boxes, each box has 5 liners.
Drawstring liners for easy pick-up and disposal
